summary: At least 30 countries have pledged over $148 billion in security assistance to Ukraine since Russia's invasion in 2022. This includes $2 billion worth of defense items of U.S. origin—such as missiles and ammunition—that foreign donors requested to transfer to Ukraine. The State Department approves these transfers, and the Defense Department is required to monitor the items. However, State hasn't consistently shared approval information with...
title: Ukraine: U.S. Agencies Should Improve Tracking of Authorized U.S.-Origin Defense Article Transfers Requested by Foreign Donors
